intro: Mormodes cartonii var. stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mormodes, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinctive texture and coloration. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
